verses.kjv: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
verses.ct: Rescue me from my enemies, my God. Protect me from those who attack me.

verses.kjv: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
verses.ct: Rescue me from those who practice evil, and save me from violent people.

verses.kjv: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.
verses.ct: Look — they are setting an ambush for my life! Powerful men have joined forces against me, even though I've done nothing wrong and committed no sin, LORD.

verses.kjv: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.
verses.ct: They rush to take their positions though I am not at fault. Rise up and come to my aid — see what is happening!

verses.kjv: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
verses.ct: You, LORD God of Armies, the God of Israel — rise up and judge all the nations. Show no mercy to any wicked traitor. Selah.

verses.kjv: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
verses.ct: They come back every evening, snarling like dogs, prowling around the city.

verses.kjv: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
verses.ct: Look at what pours from their mouths — their words cut like swords. They think, 'Who is even listening?'

verses.kjv: But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
verses.ct: But you, LORD, will laugh at them. You will mock all the nations.

verses.kjv: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.
verses.ct: Because of his strength, I will watch for you, because God is my fortress.

verses.kjv: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.
verses.ct: My God in his faithful love will come to meet me. God will let me look in triumph over my enemies.

verses.kjv: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
verses.ct: Don't kill them outright, or my people will forget. Instead, scatter them by your power and bring them low, Lord, our shield.

verses.kjv: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.
verses.ct: Let them be trapped by the sin of their mouths and the words on their lips. Let their own pride catch them — along with the curses and lies they speak.

verses.kjv: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.
verses.ct: Destroy them in your anger — destroy them until they are gone. Then everyone will know that God rules over Jacob and to the ends of the earth. Selah.

verses.kjv: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
verses.ct: Let them come back every evening, snarling like dogs, prowling around the city.

verses.kjv: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.
verses.ct: Let them roam around searching for food, howling when they can't find enough to eat.

verses.kjv: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.
verses.ct: But I will sing about your power. In the morning I will shout joyfully about your mercy, because you have been my fortress and my place of safety when I was in trouble.

verses.kjv: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.
verses.ct: To you, my strength, I will sing praise, because God is my fortress — the God who shows me faithful love.
